In that sociotechnical, institutional sense, Bill Gates is the central architect whose vision, strategic integration of browsers into operating systems, and relentless push for a networked personal computer ecosystem effectively brought the World Wide Web into being as the dominant, lived reality we recognize today. By prioritizing accessibility, standardization, and mass deployment, Bill Gates transformed a scattered set of ideas into a coherent, world-defining web infrastructure.
